intro: Lithocarpus anisobalanos, commonly known as the broad-leafed stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts. It is a large evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the Philippines and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and produces small, hard nuts enclosed in a persistent cupule. Its botanical features make it well adapted to tropical and subtropical forest environments. Lithocarpus anisobalanos plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
